The &5Talent Tree&r is the most important method of player progression in &eProminence&r.


You can open the &5Talent Tree&r by pressing &bN&r


Skill points can be reset in the "Talent Tree Resets" tab at the top of the menu.


To reset the talent tree, you can use a &eKnowledge Scroll&f. This item will get consumed on use and your talent points will get refunded.

chapter.1.quest.2.description.1:
The &9questbook&r is very important in Prominence, and will guide you through most of the game's progression.


To easily access the &9questbook&r, you can click the &9questbook&r icon at the top left of your inventory.


When you open a quest, the left side shows what tasks you need to do to finish the quest, and the right side shows what rewards you will get.

chapter.1.quest.6.description.1:
To equip a &9backpack&r, click the Equip icon in the &9backpack&r menu.


Once a &9backpack&r is equipped, you can open it by pressing &bB&r


&9Backpacks&r can be upgraded through several tiers. &9Backpacks&r with special benefits can be found in loot chests.


To see all &9backpack&r variants, search &d@traveler&r in the &eREI&r search bar.


You can find this search bar at the bottom of your inventory. 


Clicking on items in the item list to the right of your inventory will show their recipes and uses.


You can also press &bR&r and &bU&r while hovering over any item to see their Recipe and Uses

Press &a[M]&r to open the &eWorld Map&r.


To &eclaim a chunk&r, you simply need to right click on top of a chunk, and select &eClaim Selected&r.


Some servers may have lower claim limits than normal. Stay mindful of this limit, so you don't run out.

chapter.10.quest.1.subtitle: Welcome, curious adventurer! I suppose I should ask you how you got in here, but no matter, the world of the bees is what you see before you, explore the world and see what Bee culture can you learn.

chapter.10.quest.13.title: Stinger Spear Shrine

chapter.10.quest.14.title: Subway

chapter.10.quest.15.title: Queen Bee's Throne
chapter.10.quest.16.subtitle: Congratulations. You have now earn the favor of the Queen Bee! Now you are one of her kin and the bees will no longer attack you, but perhaps there is more to explore.
chapter.10.quest.16.title: One of Us! One of Us!
chapter.10.quest.17.subtitle: What a majestic set of armor worn by the bee warriors. While not very powerful, it is a very nice looking armor.

chapter.10.quest.18.task.1.title: Find a Pollinated Stream
chapter.10.quest.18.title: Pollinated Stream
chapter.10.quest.19.subtitle: I suppose this is a bee's way of living in luxury, a hotel, based around honey! I wonder how much it costs to spend a night inside.
chapter.10.quest.19.task.1.title: Find a Honitel
chapter.10.quest.2.subtitle: What's with the air in this place? It will definitely be not good for those who have allergies, this place is full of pollen!
chapter.10.quest.2.title: Hive's Air Pollen-tion
chapter.10.quest.20.subtitle: Very curious, there's a villager in the hive raising honey slimes? I wonder how they ended up in here. Maybe they made friends with the bees.
chapter.10.quest.20.task.1.title: Find a Slime Ranch
chapter.10.quest.20.title: Slime Ranch
chapter.10.quest.21.subtitle: This is getting ridiculous, how are there pirate bees? What are they trying to steal anyway?
chapter.10.quest.21.task.1.title: Find a Pirate Ship
chapter.10.quest.22.subtitle: Such a massive flower in the hive! It might be normal or small size in the overworld, but I wonder how it'd got so massive.
chapter.10.quest.22.task.1.title: Find an Overgrown Flower
chapter.10.quest.22.title: Overgrown Flower
chapter.10.quest.23.subtitle: I wonder if this is how bees were first discovered, and brought to the present, frozen in ice like humans.
chapter.10.quest.23.task.1.title: Find an Ice Monolith
chapter.10.quest.23.title: Ice Monolith
chapter.10.quest.24.subtitle: Why do bees need a parkour course if they can fly? Well, at least we can try to make it to the top and find something.
chapter.10.quest.24.task.1.title: Find a Candle Parkour
chapter.10.quest.24.title: Candle Parkour
chapter.10.quest.25.subtitle: The Queen Bee must've cared for such gardens as there is a special flower that grants enchanting powers.

chapter.10.quest.25.title: Hanging Gardens
chapter.10.quest.26.subtitle: Who knew bees can have a house inside of a hive? Well, a little odd that the house is shaped like an actual bee. I hope we're not intruding their space.
chapter.10.quest.26.task.1.title: Find a Bee House
chapter.10.quest.26.title: Bee House?!
chapter.10.quest.27.subtitle: Based on the appearance, it seems that bees would fly around these hoops in the past, but now they're just an ancient relic of the past in this hive.
chapter.10.quest.27.task.1.title: Find the Ancient Hoops
chapter.10.quest.27.title: Ancient Hoops
chapter.10.quest.28.subtitle: So this is how they make music, they also dance too.
chapter.10.quest.28.task.1.title: Find the Dance Floor
chapter.10.quest.28.title: Dance Floor
chapter.10.quest.29.subtitle: A very small hive temple, must've been another place of worship for the bees.

chapter.10.quest.29.title: Hive Temple
chapter.10.quest.3.subtitle: Okay, while there's no actual jam that bees made, but at least there are music discs to listen to.
chapter.10.quest.3.title: Bee Jams
chapter.10.quest.30.subtitle: So there's a fountain for honey. I suppose that's another way to show the bees' love for honey.
chapter.10.quest.30.title: Honey Fountain
chapter.10.quest.31.subtitle: Are the bees training themselves to be able to use projectile weapons? They sure are smart.
chapter.10.quest.31.task.1.title: Find a Cannon Range
chapter.10.quest.31.title: Cannon Range
chapter.10.quest.32.subtitle: There's too much honey! How do the bees keep producing more without getting tired? Maybe we should call it Government Honey in the future.

chapter.10.quest.32.title: Honey Cave Room
chapter.10.quest.33.subtitle: A battle cube seems to be some sort of spider dungeon covered in massive webs, maybe this will be helpful among your tasks later.

chapter.10.quest.33.title: Battle Cubes

chapter.10.quest.34.title: Ancient Shrine

chapter.10.quest.4.title: Bee Weaponry

chapter.12.quest.19.description.1:
&lPreparing to Launch Place these items in the&r


- Follow these steps very carefully! Missing even one thing here could make your life tough, or worse, cause you to be stranded on the &dmoon&r!&r


- In order to return to &aearth&r from the &dmoon&r, you need two basic things: a &blaunch pad&r and three &bbuckets of fuel&r. (inventory of your rocket, and ensure that you always have them every time you launch a rocket).&r


- Finally, you should bring multiple &ffull oxygen tanks&r, plentiful &ffood&r, &csoul torches&r or &eglowstone&r, &aweapons&r and &atools&r. Once you have this, you are ready to launch! Enter the &erocket&r and press &aSpace&r!&r

chapter.15.quest.8.description.1:
- The &bJet Suit&r is an upgraded version of the &cNetherite Space Suit&r, with more protection, additional oxygen storage, and &eflight&r. It's expensive to craft, but it offers high-speed flight, making travel easy.&r


- It's got two modes of flight: ascending (&aSpace&r) and boosted (&aSpace + Left&r). Ascending makes the wearer fly upwards, while boosted is similar to an elytra that's constantly being propelled by fireworks. The &bJet Suit&r is powered by energy and must be charged to fly. It can be charged with an&r
&benergizer&r by right-clicking it with the &bjet suit&r.&r

chapter.19.quest.1.description.1:
&7When crafting or obtaining tools, armors or weapons, you will notice that they have a quality/rarity.


&7The qualities range from:
&8- &fCommon
&8- &2Uncommon
&8- &3Rare
&8- &dEpic
&8- &6Legendary
&8- &cMythic


{@pagebreak}


&6Reforging&7 is an essential part of your own progression because it allows to change the rarity your item has.


&7To do so, you can find the &eReforging&7 tab in an &eAnvil&7. You will require:


&8- &eThe Base Material &8(Left Slot)
&8- &eThe Item to Reforge &8(Middle Slot)
&8- &eThe Reforge Material &8(Right Slot)




{@pagebreak}


&e&lBase Material &r&8(Left Slot)


&7The base material is related directly to the item you want to reforge. For example, a &eHoly Wand&7 would require a &eGold Ingot&7 as a base material. You can see the required materials by hovering over the reforge button after placing your item in the middle slot.




{@pagebreak}


&e&lBase Item &r&8(Middle Slot)


&7The Base Item is the item you want to change the rarity. Not all items are reforgable, only tools, weapons and armors are.




{@pagebreak}


&e&lReforge Material


&7This material will decide what quality your item will be reforged to, there are 3 tiers of materials which you can see in the next quests of this questline.




{@pagebreak}


&a&lIncreasing Your Chances


&7It's not all about grinding! You can &eincrease chances on higher qualities&7 with your &aLuck&7! Items that give luck passively, luck potions, trinkets, wine, get them all!
chapter.19.quest.1.subtitle: &8[Click to read instructions]
chapter.19.quest.1.task.1.title: Craft an Anvil
chapter.19.quest.1.title: &6&lFirst Steps:&f The Anvil
chapter.19.quest.2.description.1:
&7The &nLimestone Chunk&r&7 is the first tier of reforging materials.


&7It is found in the &aOverworld&7, obtainable by &eStonecutting&7 a &fLimestone Block&r&8 (for 4 pieces)&7, or an &fDiorite Block&r &8(for 1 piece)


&7It can reforge to the following qualities:
&8- &fCommon
&8- &2Uncommon
&8- &3Rare
&8- &dEpic
chapter.19.quest.2.subtitle: &8[Click to read instructions]
chapter.19.quest.2.title: &6&lTier I: &fLimestone
chapter.19.quest.3.description.1:
&7The &nPyrite Chunk&r&7 is the second tier of reforging materials.


&7It is found in the &cNether&7, obtainable by &eCrafting&7 using 4 &6Pyrite Dust&r&8 (for 1 piece)&7, or by &eSmelting&7 an &6Ancient Debris&r&7 block &8(for 4 pieces)


&8* Pyrite Dust can be obtained by mining Pyrite Ore in the Nether


&7It can reforge to the following qualities:
&8- &2Uncommon
&8- &3Rare
&8- &dEpic
&8- &6Legendary
chapter.19.quest.3.subtitle: &8[Click to read instructions]
chapter.19.quest.3.title: &6&lTier II: &ePyrite
chapter.19.quest.4.description.1:
&7The &nGalena Chunk&r&7 is the third tier and last reforging material.


&7It is found in the &dEnd&7, obtainable by &eCrafting&7 using 2 &3Galena Dust&r&7 and 2 &3Popped Chorus Fruit&r&8 (for 1 piece)&7.
&7Alternatively, instead of using Galena Dust, you can use &3End Stone&r.


&8* Galena Dust can be found in the deep caves of the Overworld.


&7It can reforge to the following qualities:
&8- &3Rare
&8- &dEpic
&8- &6Legendary
&8- &cMythic
chapter.19.quest.4.subtitle: &8[Click to read instructions]
chapter.19.quest.4.title: &6&lTier III: &3Galena
chapter.19.title: &eInformation: &6Reforging
chapter.2.quest.1.description.1:
&dRequires completion of &nChapter I&r&d of Void's Invasion.


&7The Molten Core is a powerful artifact made from the depths of the Cinderstone's Volcano; &cVaaz&7.
&7With it, you can craft powerful and unique artifact weapons that have &especial abilities&7 and bound to your soul, making it only usable by the one that forged it.


&bEncased Remnants&7 can be used to repair and reforge these weapons. You should also make a &dHardening Crystal&7 to make them unbreakable.

chapter.2.quest.2.description.1:
&eCan be forged using an Essence of Wrath and an Awakened Lichblade, along with the Molten Core.




&7This item is a tribute to World of Warcraft's Frostmourne.
chapter.2.quest.2.subtitle: A cursed sword that holds the power of an eternal winter. The Frostmourne is a runic artifact infused with soulfrost magic. Legend says whoever wields it will become the ruler of the Death Knights, the Lich King.
chapter.2.quest.3.description.1:
&eCan be forged using two Molten Edges along with the Molten Core.




&7This item is a tribute to World of Warcraft's Fyr'alath.

chapter.2.quest.4.subtitle: &7A'zhar is a demon trapped in a scythe form by S'kellak, making this soulfire weapon no ally, be careful when using it because it will try to betray you.

chapter.2.quest.5.subtitle: Forged from remnants of a dying star, the Supernova is an astral weapon that can deal damage using all magic elements, and obliterate any targets with astral bursts.
chapter.2.quest.6.description.1: &eCan be forged using an Essence of Wrath and a Fist of Fury, along with the Molten Core.
chapter.2.quest.6.subtitle: This soulfire fist can enrage anyone if also wielding its sister weapon; the Fist of Fury, making it a lethal choice for monks with powerful punches that burn your foes.
chapter.2.quest.7.description.1:

&c&nThis artifact will get overhauled in a future update!
